intro: Teucrium divaricatum, commonly known as blue germander, is a perennial herb native to North America. It features slender, upright stems that are often hairy and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually blue-green in color and have a slightly fuzzy texture. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically blue or purple, arranged in dense spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in dry, rocky soils.
